items.sentence: Tom became a dancer even though his parents didn\'t want him to.
Tom couldn\'t see the point in having to fill out so many forms.
I should be able to take care of Tom for you tomorrow afternoon.
If it\'s possible, I\'d like to exchange this for a larger size.
I bet the prices won\'t be much higher than they were last time.
I can read Chinese fairly well, but I can\'t write it very well.
I can\'t believe Tom is giving Mary the car he bought last year.
Tom is better prepared this time, so he should be able to do it.
Tom is the only one in our family who knows how to speak French.
Tom opened his mouth to say something, but Mary interrupted him.
Tom reached into his desk drawer and took out a medicine bottle.
I hope I have an opportunity to meet Tom when I\'m in Australia.
I knew that Tom didn\'t want me to do that, but I did it anyway.
I think Tom would like to know that you\'re planning to do that.
I think it\'s time for me to admit that I never cared about you.
Tom was on a diet, so all he ate for dessert was one strawberry.
We have a visitor right now. Would you mind waiting for a while?
I wonder whether or not Tom has ever considered cycling to work.
It would hurt your reputation if you went to the party with Tom.
Tom always keeps a set of jumper cables in the trunk of his car.
